intro: Schiedeella obtecta, commonly known as the rock fig, is a unique plant species native to southern Africa. It is a small, evergreen shrub that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its small, greenish-white flowers are followed by edible, fleshy fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Schiedeella obtecta is well adapted to harsh, dry conditions and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions.
